alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Cascade; Chouteau; Fergus; Hill; Judith Basin; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 31 at 1:10PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...POTENTIAL FOR MINOR FLOODING FROM LOCALIZED HEAVY RAINFALL THOUGH THURDAY WITH MORE WIDEPSREAD RAIN LIKELY FRIDAY... A moist and unstable southerly flow will bring scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms each day with a period of steadier widespread rain likely across north-central Montana Friday. Deep moisture will lead to heavy downpours with thunderstorms through Thursday and slow storm movement will lead to localized heavy rainfall and a small risk (5% or less) of flash flooding. Widespread rain on Friday is expected across north-central and central Montana and there is a greater than 50% chance for precipitation amounts of 1 inch or more across primarily eastern portions of north-central Montana. Localized heavy rainfall with thunderstorms through Thursday could bring some isolated minor flooding risks, including the potential for street flooding and standing water in poorly drained areas. Creeks and streams across eastern portions of north-central Montana are also likely to see higher flows through the upcoming weekend.
